programme.title: Car History
programme.desc: Racing has been a matter of the heart for Ford for over 100 years. Henry Ford already wins the first race with his first car. Thousands of other victories were to follow.

programme.title: Car History
programme.desc: The development of engineering at BMW has always been closely linked to motorsport. Racing has always played a decisive role in shaping the brand and setting the pace for its future.

programme.title: Car History
programme.desc: In the 1980s and 90s, Porsche races from victory to victory. A McLaren with Porsche engine wins the Formula 1 World Championship three times. In Le Mans in 1982, Porsche starts an unbelievable winning streak with the new 956/962 prototype.

programme.title: Glas 1700 GT
programme.desc: The Glas GT looks like a Ferrari, but comes from the province of Lower Bavaria in Germany. In the early 1960s it was one of the few German sports cars.

programme.title: Peugeot 205 Turbo 16
programme.desc: Peugeot released this classic, all wheel drive monster for one purpose only: It should bring the World Rally Championship to France. The Peugeot 205 Turbo 16 shook up the rally world in the 80s.

programme.title: Tuning
programme.desc: At the "Day of Thunder" in Magdeburg, Germany, two- and four-wheelers take part in Europe's most famous 1/8 mile race.

programme.title: Tuning
programme.desc: Already in the eighth season of the German Race Wars, visitors from over 20 countries make their pilgrimage to the big event. And: The Mini John Cooper Works is the racing version of the Bavarian racer. Arden turns it into the Arden Mini AM 3.

programme.title: Tuning
programme.desc: For BMW tuner Manhart Racing, the Nurburgring Nordschleife is the ideal place to celebrate its 25th anniversary. As part of the Track Days, customers and interested parties will have the opportunity to get to know the Manhart models.

programme.title: Tuning
programme.desc: Once a year, car tuning fans from all over the country meet at Neue Messe Dresden for the XS CarNight. On 35,000 square metres automotive dreams can be admired there while the lights go out outside.

programme.title: Tuning
programme.desc: Unlike the countless Show & Shine car meetings, at the Rust'n'Roll the older means the better. Only when the vehicles look really old and are as rusty as possible are they considered beautiful.

programme.title: Tuning
programme.desc: The NitrolympX is a motor sport event that was first held in Hockenheim in 1986. With about 30,000 spectators and around 300 participants, it is the largest international drag race event in Europe.

programme.title: A tuned Beetle!
programme.desc: It looks like a Volkswagen Beetle from the Seventies. But with contemporary tuning, 90 horse power and 112 mph top speed, it promises unlimited driving pleasure.

programme.title: Put your car on TV
programme.desc: The search for the fastest, best looking and best sounding car continues. Once more car lovers from the Middle East bring their tuned vehicles to the Sofitel Dubai Jumeirah Beach and have it judged by Saif Hattawi. The winner receives a special treat for two people from the luxurious Sofitel Dubai Jumeirah Beach. A Ford Mustang and a limited edition Chevrolet Corvette try to win the competition.

programme.title: Put your car on TV
programme.desc: Put Your Car on TV gives every car owner the chance to bring their tuned machines to the Sofitel Hotel Dubai Jumeirah beach. There, Saif Hattawi will assess each car based on speed, style and sound. The person with the most amazing car wins a one night stay at the Sofitel Hotel Dubai Jumeirah Beach for two people. A BMW X6M, a massive Ford F250 and a special Nissan Patrol try to win this prize.

programme.title: Put your car on TV
programme.desc: The Walk' at JBR, the most prestigious location in Dubai, sets the background for the fastest customized cars in the Middle East. Put Your Car on TV invites car owners to present their cars and have it judged. The owner of the fastest, most beautiful and best sounding car wins a special treat from Sofitel Dubai Jumeirah Beach. Among the competitors are a Lamborghini Aventador and a GMC Chevrolet.

programme.title: Put your car on TV
programme.desc: Once more, Mylene Gomera and Saif Hattawi are on the hunst for the most amazing cars in the world and ask car owners to bring their customized vehicles to Dubai, where it will be awarded points based on speed, style and sound. The car with the points wins a stay at the Sofitel Hotel Dubai Jumeirah Beach for two people. Among the presented cars are a limited edition Mercedes SLS and an Audi R8.

programme.title: Put your car on TV
programme.desc: On Put Your Car on TV people from the Middle East present their tuned vehicles. They are rewarded with points based on its styling, the highest (possible) speed ever driven und naturally also its sound. Whoever receives the most points, wins a luxurious treat from the Sofitel Hotel Dubai Jumeirah Beach. This time, a Lexus GSF, a Ford Mustang and a McLaren MP4-12C are put on the spotlight.

programme.title: Mercedes-AMG GT S Performmaster
programme.desc: Not far from Stuttgart is the home of the tuner Performmaster who specialize in the performance optimization of Mercedes-AMG models. They turned the already more-than-potent GT S sports car into a beast.

programme.title: Beradino
programme.desc: A „bella macchina“, a beautiful car - but not designed by masters like Bertone or Pininfarina. Johannes Paulussen from Neuss in Germany built the Beradino by hand.

programme.title: Seacon UK Rally Show by Special Stage
programme.desc: Experience the thrill of the UK's best winter rallies, with icy roads, skilled drivers, and stunning landscapes!

programme.title: Seacon UK Rally Show by Special Stage
programme.desc: We show rallies from all parts of the United Kingdom, starting with the Malcolm Wilson Rally at the Lake District.

programme.title: Seacon UK Rally Show by Special Stage
programme.desc: In the third episode of the UK Rally Show, we show the highlights from the Severn Valley Stages competition in Wales.

programme.title: Jaguar XJR
programme.desc: The highlight of the XJR lies beneath the hood: all of Jaguar's top models are equipped with the 5-liter V8 compressor engine that delivers 550 HP in this sports sedan.

programme.title: Trackmasters
programme.desc: In this episode we invite you to witness the progress of driver Uwe Nittle as he got ready for qualifying at the Truck Grand Prix.

programme.title: Trackmasters
programme.desc: The RCN Challenge is the ultimate BMW driving experience. We also paid a visit to the Devils Diner, the track's indoor meeting place for drivers.

programme.title: Trackmasters
programme.desc: After the 24-hour race was over we left the Nürburgring and moved to Büren, Germany, where the Raeder Motorsport company is based. They are famous for front-wheel drives with a great performance that put a lot of horsepower to the track.

programme.title: Trackmasters
programme.desc: The roaring sounds of engines and exhausts usually dominate the Nürburgring, but we focused on something a bit quieter this time. How about taking part in a 15 mile bike ride around the ring, or perhaps a 16 mile run?

programme.title: Artega GT
programme.desc: From 2006 to 2012 the German company Artega produced their GT sports car model. Thanks to the know-how of a former Porsche and BMW manager the Artega GT was able to be manufactured in a small series.

programme.title: Supercars
programme.desc: The Bentley New Flying Spur and the Rolls Royce Wraith are both an extremely exclusive breed of cars. These luxurious power packs make for an almost transcendental driving experience and deliver the perfect combination of elegance and performance.

programme.title: Supercars
programme.desc: There are names that sound like music in car enthusiasts' ears: the Mc Laren MP4 12C, the Porsche 911 Turbo S and the Mercedes SLS AMG GT are super sports cars that are second to none. We put the pedal to the metal in these exciting and powerful driving machines.

programme.title: Supercars
programme.desc: 1,000 kilometers on the famous Nurburgring. It's the final race of the 2013 season. The Blancpain Endurance Series is a racing event for grand tourers like the Ferrari 458 Italia, the McLaren MP4-12 C or the Nissan GT-R Nismo GT3. We took a look at all the action, the drivers, their cars and the competition.

programme.title: Mercedes 300 SL Lightweight
programme.desc: An iconic racing car and one of only 29 ever built! We accompanied the Mercedes 300 SL 'lightweight' on its premiere drive at the Mille Miglia.

programme.title: Bentley Bentayga
programme.desc: With the Bentley Bentayga, the traditional British brand is entering the fastest growing market segment. This world's first luxury SUV is a conglomerate of superlatives on wheels.

programme.title: Classic Races
programme.desc: The Pikes Peak Hill Climb is a rather unique type of car race in the mountains of Colorado, USA. It's exciting, tough and dangerous, and in 1987, two-time world rally champion Walter Röhrl took his Audi Sport Quattro S1 to the top.

programme.title: Classic Races
programme.desc: In the 1930s the famous Silver Arrows by Auto Union that were designed by Ferdinand Porsche celebrated great successes at the European Drivers' Championship and several Grand Prix races despite the strong competition by Mercedes-Benz.

programme.title: Classic Races
programme.sub-title: Rallye Year 1972 - A Ford success story
programme.desc: The International Championship for Manufacturers was a rally series which was run from 1970 to 1972. Car manufacturers such as Porsche, Renault, Opel and Ford took part in this competition, with Ford having an exceptionally successful year in 1972.

programme.title: Mercedes 300 SL Lightweight
programme.desc: An iconic racing car and one of only 29 ever built! We accompanied the Mercedes 300 SL 'lightweight' on its premiere drive at the Mille Miglia.

programme.title: Bentley Mulsanne EWB
programme.desc: The long version of the Bentley Mulsanne is a prime example of a chauffeured limousine. With it, the British luxury car brand has set the bar extremely high when it comes to automotive comfort.

programme.title: Stunt Heroes
programme.desc: Martial arts specialist Ramazan creates a fight choreography that involves four stuntmen who play secret agents that try to nail him down. And somebody will spectacularly take off with a car.

programme.title: Stunt Heroes
programme.desc: Fog, darkness and a pileup involving multiple cars, the Stunt Heroes want to recreate such a scene as part of a stunt with burning people, a fireman who arrives late at the scene and a car that flies through the air.

programme.title: Stunt Heroes
programme.desc: The Stunt Heroes leave their headquarters and travel to a ski resort. They simulate the attack of an army of soldiers all dressed in white. As part of this scene they want to make a car explode and fly through the air.

programme.title: Toyota GT86 J-Sport
programme.desc: With the Toyota GT 86 from J-Sport, it is noticeable that the company's roots lie in racing. The fans' wish to give the Japanese racer significantly more power nevertheless remained unfulfilled.

programme.title: Porsche Cayman GT4
programme.desc: The Porsche Cayman GT4. Lighter, more powerful and faster than ever. Porsche shows what is possible with this vehicle, when fast lap times are in the focus of attention.

programme.title: Offroad & Fun, Part 35
programme.desc: Hail Rally & FIM X-Trials Championship 2025.

programme.title: Offroad & Fun, Part 35
programme.desc: Hail Rally & FIM X-Trials Championship 2025.
